text: Ronojoy Dutta also known as Rono Dutta is an Indian aviation executive who is currently the CEO of InterGlobe Aviation which operates IndiGo Airlines and he was president of United Airlines from 1999 to 2002. ==Career== Dutta is the co-founder, managing director, member of management committee, and member of investment committee at Achuthan & Co. L.L.C. Prior to working here, Dutta was a partner at the firm and also a strategic advisor of AAR Corp. With over 25 years of experience, in the aviation industry, Dutta has a lot to offer. From July 2004 until 2006 he served as chairman of Air Sahara, and from 2004 until 2008 Dutta served as the president of Sahara Airline Limited. He later grew sales at 35 percent a year. In 2007, Mr. Dutta joined US-based AAR Corporation as a strategic adviser for the Indian market.aarcorp.com – Press Releases From 1995 until 1999, prior to becoming the president of United Airlines, Dutta served as the senior vice president of planning and revenue management. Mr. Dutta took on the role of CEO at InterGlobe Aviation on 24 January 2019. ==Organizations== *Member of board of trustees of Ravinia Festival in Chicago. ==Education== Dutta studied in St. Edmund's School, Shillong and obtained his degrees from Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur and Harvard Business School. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:American businessmen of Indian descent Category:United Airlines people Category:Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur alumni Category:Harvard Business School alumni Category:Indian emigrants to the United States
title: Rono Dutta
